turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about SCB-125.
turn.1: What is the meaning of SCB-125?
turn.2: SCB-125  SCB-125 was the United States Navy designation for a series of upgrades to the of aircraft carriers conducted between 1954 and 1959.
turn.4: These upgrades included the addition of an angled flight deck and other enhancements aimed at improving flight operations and seakeeping.
turn.6: The SCB-125 modifications included  The SCB-125 upgrade program was first applied to the final three "Essex"-class carriers to undergo the SCB-27C modernization while they were still in the midst of their original refit.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: Ultimately every SCB-27 ship would undergo the SCB-125 modification with the exception of .
turn.10: Despite the drastic alteration of the carriers' appearance, the SCB-125 refit involved relatively little modification of the ships' existing structure compared to SCB-27, and took around six to nine months as against the approximately two years of the earlier program.
turn.12: The original SCB-27A vessels, which were fitted with a pair of H 8 hydraulic catapults, were not upgraded with the C 11 steam catapults fitted to their SCB-27C sister ships due to machinery space limitations.
